post.body: Wow, this social network is… kinda nice.
Is this why there's so many more Chinese users on zeronet lately? https://torrentfreak.com/china-ban-unauthorized-vpn-services-in-internet-crackdown-170123/

comment.body: Do you speak English? I know some things about tor, if you're having issues.

@Yinyue: China uses Deep Packet Inspection to block tor in its default configuration. https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E3%83%87%E3%82%A3%E3%83%BC%E3%83%97%E3%83%BB%E3%83%91%E3%82%B1%E3%83%83%E3%83%88%E3%83%BB%E3%82%A4%E3%83%B3%E3%82%B9%E3%83%9A%E3%82%AF%E3%82%B7%E3%83%A7%E3%83%B3

You must use a pluggable transport to get around it (sorry, I don't know a Chinese article). https://www.torproject.org/docs/bridges
@12hlearn: You shouldn't need to worry about a control part on android. If it's being blocked by the firewall, you may need to use a bridge. https://www.torproject.org/docs/bridges

@12hlearn: Oh, right. I don't think a control port is configured by default, so you'll have to look at the manual. I may be able to help you if you have a hard time reading it, but I haven't done any of this myself. https://www.torproject.org/docs/tor-manual.html.en
@Niba: What does 66666 mean where he's from?
P.S.: The notice referenced in the article: http://www.miit.gov.cn/n1146295/n1652858/n1652930/n3757020/c5471946/content.html
I've used it before. It works pretty nicely.
